feed.title: MSFS Blog
feed.subtitle: Development updates of Microsoft Flight Simulator.

entry.title: March 30th, 2023 Development Update
entry.summary: This week’s Screenshot Challenge winner is Twitter user 2525ARW, featuring a Boeing 747 touching down on a rain-slick runway. If you’re interested in participating in our weekly Screenshot Challenges, check out the contest details in the Community section below!As March comes to a close, we are happy to recognize Women’s History Month with a feature interview … Continued

entry.title: Microsoft Flight Simulator Spring Sale
entry.summary: Enjoy discounted pricing during our Microsoft Flight Simulator Spring Sale!

entry.title: April 6th, 2023 Development Update
entry.summary: This week’s Screenshot Challenge winner is Twitter user pommes_l, featuring a Boeing 747 flying over New York City. If you’re interested in participating in our weekly Screenshot Challenges, check out the contest details in the Community section below! Earlier today, we announced the annual Spring Sale in the Marketplace. Over 1,100 products currently have reduced … Continued

entry.title: April 13th, 2023 Development Update
entry.summary: Our Spring Marketplace Sale continues until April 21. Enjoy savings of up to 93% off on over 1,100 products for both PC and Xbox.

entry.title: April 20th, 2023 Development Update
entry.summary: The team is currently hard at work preparing for the imminent launch of World Update XIII: Oceania and Expert Series I: ATR 42-600 / 72-600. Both are targeted for release next week on Tuesday, April 25.

entry.title: America’s First Black Astronauts
entry.summary: During the Cold War space race of the 1960s, there were three truths about American astronauts: Every astronaut was a major celebrity, mobbed by the media and an adoring public alike wherever they went. Every astronaut was recruited to the space program exclusively from the ranks of military test pilots. Every astronaut was a white … Continued

entry.title: Local Legend VIII: DHC-4 Caribou
entry.summary: One of the most capable aircraft for austere and bush flying, the DHC-4 Caribou, is the eighth in the Local Legend Series.

entry.title: Women’s History Month: A Conversation with Patty Wagstaff
entry.summary: You can’t talk about aerobatic flying without talking about Patty Wagstaff: a 3-time US National Aerobatic Champion; a 6-time members of the US Aerobatic Team; a gold, silver, and bronze medal winner in the International Aerobatic Competition; an inductee in the National Aviation Hall of Fame; and the first woman to win the title of … Continued
